metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12791 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in minion id validation in SaltStack Salt before 2016.11.7 and 2017.7.x before 2017.7.1 allows remote minions with incorrect credentials to authenticate to a master via a crafted minion ID. It was discovered that the salt allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files via a special crafted file. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a DoS or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-cloud - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-common - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-master - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-minion - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-proxy - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-ssh - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-syndic - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: salt package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2017.7.4+dfsg1-1').
